metadata.title: CVE-2023-51767 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: OpenSSH through 9.6, when common types of DRAM are used, might allow rowhammer attacks (for authentication bypass) because the integer value of authenticated in mm_answer_authpassword does not resist flips of a single bit. NOTE: this is applicable to a certain threat model of attacker-victim co-location in which the attacker has user privileges.

criterions.comment: openssh package in jammy is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2024-01-02').
openssh-ssh1 package in jammy is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2024-01-02').
